pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [3ab599b4a7](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20489/commits/3ab599b4a76696ec3680f9ef91f75945900fa95e)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Algebra.Azumaya.Defs` (new file)|1024|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ IsAzumaya`
`+ TensorProduct.Algebra.moduleAux'`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
Is this map `R`-bilinear? You are lifting it some lines below, might as well make it a bilinear map here.
deleted
Is [Algebra.TensorProduct.lift](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/RingTheory/TensorProduct/Basic.html#Algebra.TensorProduct.lift) useful here

what about
```lean
noncomputable abbrev endo : (A ⊗[R] Aᵐᵒᵖ) →ₐ[R] Module.End R A :=
Algebra.TensorProduct.lift
  (Algebra.lsmul R R A) (Algebra.lsmul R R A)
  (by
    intro a b
    ext x
    simp [commute_iff_eq, mul_assoc])
```
changed

```suggestion
# Azumaya Algebras

```

```suggestion
An Azumaya algebra over a commutative ring `R` is a finitely generated, projective 
and faithful R-algebra
```
(and sort out pagination)
Can you add tags and references following the community guidelines for module docstrings here https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/doc.html ?
done!
This surely can't go in the root namespace, and it has a bad name: `endo` is not in the mathlib naming convention.
what name do you suggest I'm really bad at naming stuff :((
`Module.End.ofTensorProductMulOpposite` maybe?
Better yet, reuse `TensorProduct.Algebra.moduleAux` which is already almost exactly this definition
should I use the map to prove it as well?

```suggestion
where the tensor product `A ⊗[R] Aᵐᵒᵖ` is isomorphic to the endomorphism ring of A `End R A`
```
Why not `extend` this too?
it gives an error I don't know why

It gives this error:
`parent field type mismatch, field 'out' from parent 'Module.Finite' has type
  ⊤.FG : Prop
but is expected to have type
  ∃ s, Function.LeftInverse ⇑(Finsupp.linearCombination R id) ⇑s : Prop`
Can you list these other definitions in this to-do? It's hard to review if you've chosen the best one otherwise
sure thing will do
This should be added to `references.bib`
what's reference.bib
A file in mathlib

pullRequest.title: feat(Algebra/Azumaya/Defs): Define Azumaya algebras
